description: CRITICAL: Code should represent domain concepts directly. Domain models should match code. If code doesn't match domain concepts, refactor the code rather than creating abstract domain models.

do.description: Code should represent domain concepts directly
content: If code doesn't match domain, refactor the code

dont.description: Don't create abstract code that doesn't match domain
content: Don't create classes that don't represent domain concepts
Don't separate code from domain model
# Domain model says 'Analyze portfolio' but code doesn't exist
# This is abstract code, not representing actual domain
- Classes that don't exist in domain model
- Methods that are abstract concepts without domain representation
- Code that describes ideal state rather than actual domain
